message_1: What is the smallest positive integer n such that there exists a computer program that can determine whether any other given computer program will eventually halt or run forever, in at most n steps?
message_2: There is no such positive integer n. This is a well-known result in computer science and mathematics called the Halting Problem, which was proven to be undecidable by Alan Turing in 1936. The proof shows that there cannot exist a general algorithm or computer program that can determine whether any other given computer program will eventually halt or run forever.
